text:
1/ Moderna's #COVID19 vaccine was approved for use in 12-17 year olds in Canada.

I am a firm believer in COVID-19 vaccines, including for this age cohort.

NACI has a statement that is worth reading. 
1. Summary: https://t.co/9WdcHLDn8F
2. Whole Megillah: https://t.co/G6cbhJcBl0

RT @adamsmiller: Canada has released new data on COVID-19 cases, hospitalizations and deaths after vaccination.

Not surprisingly, the unva‚Ä¶

1/ Ontario's #COVID19 Vaccine Distribution Task Force is wrapping up operations.

This was a challenging role & I am thankful for the opportunity to serve.

Also, "thank you" to all involved. There were many behind the scenes doing a lot of heavy lifting.

https://t.co/8h1JkjorV5 https://t.co/7onrmpZGwN https://t.co/ZBSX9y9bGC

And like clockwork, BC has a large jump in #COVID19 vaccine bookings (‚¨ÜÔ∏è 200%) after announcing that proof of vaccination will soon be required for nonessential settings like restaurants, movies, etc.

Cohort with the largest rise? The under 40 crowd.

 https://t.co/iIywNwE5Z8

Look at the risk of adverse events following vaccination (blue) versus #COVID19 infection (gold).

Myocarditis, pericarditis, blood clots, intracranial bleeding, etc are all substantially more common following infection versus vaccination.

From @NEJM: https://t.co/hQEtYXZG8h https://t.co/Ot3ezAVErV

#COVID19 vaccine effectiveness continue to hold up strong against hospitalization (91.9% - 95.3%), even in the context of Delta variant. 

(This is impressive real-world data from New York).

Study: https://t.co/e0EOgKeMqw

Hospitalization of unvaccinated VS vax'd, from CNBC üëá https://t.co/Gfw23OPmcX

A very swift & impressive #COVID19  outbreak response in New Zealand. 

But also almost no room for error with Delta variant. https://t.co/ODSvSYEkl2
RT @l_stone: NEW: Ontario has hit target of 75% of 12+ with 2 shots of COVID vaccine, says it's deploying "last mile strategy" to reach are‚Ä¶
RT @LaurenPelley: NEW: The B.C. government has announced a plan to require proof of #COVID19 vaccination ‚Äî new "B.C. vaccine cards" ‚Äî for a‚Ä¶

Canada's 2nd & 3rd #COVID19 waves posed significant challenges, with a high burden of disease in much (but not all) of the country, stretching ICU & hospital capacity.

While vaccines certainly help, wave 4 may see more of the same.

With @ADetsky; https://t.co/0WwDNk9y6t https://t.co/8LaVtgjFP1

The US FDA has granted Pfizer's #COVID19 vaccine full approval.

This will help move the needle [heh] on vaccine efforts...some who were on the fence will likely now get vaccinated.

(And of course, some will not).

https://t.co/g8afSSm7uf

More emerging data demonstrating that vaccinated individuals with a breakthrough #COVID19 infection shed less virus compared to those who are unvaccinated & infected...& are likely less contagious.

(Most cases were Delta here)

Preprint: https://t.co/whnO4fr1hw h/t @pelagicbird https://t.co/ZprPenr95Y

There are a growing number of #COVID19 vaccine success stories from low income countries, like Togo vaccinating 90% of healthcare workersüëá...

...but COVAX is still very far from enabling widespread vaccination in these settings due to a lack of support from global partners. https://t.co/lwEKXZ5bdZ https://t.co/vPjVX13fkb

A growing number of Canadian settings are implementing vaccine/immunity certificates‚Ä¶limiting access to non-essential businesses to those with proof of vaccine (or a negative test in some cases), as #COVID19 cases rise.

BC looks like it will follow suit. https://t.co/AOqL1Z837w
RT @CalderwoodMD: Nice real world data from NY showing that while #COVID19 vaccine protection against laboratory-confirmed infection has fa‚Ä¶

#COVID19 vaccines continue to hold strong in Canada, significantly preventing infection & greatly reducing hospitalization or the need for ICU care.

But still need to‚¨ÜÔ∏è1st doses.

ENGLAND cases in‚Ä¶

#COVID19 vaccine effectiveness from Qatar:

>97% for Pfizer & Moderna against severe illness/death...metrics that really matter.

(59.6% vs infection for Pfizer; 86.1% vs infection for Moderna)

More emerging data on Moderna's ‚¨ÜÔ∏è immunogenicity.

Preprint: https://t.co/PCVCD2RGmG https://t.co/aYZt7P26Zs

#COVID19 booster vaccine summary:

Do some need boosters now? YES

Does everyone need a booster now? NO

Will we all need boosters in the future? MAYBE vs PROBABLY

Should we urgently get more shots to low/middle income countries? DEFINITELY
RT @LisaGralinski: Just chatted with @WRAL about the new US plans for #COVID19 booster shots for the general public. In a nutshell, I think‚Ä¶

On #COVID19 booster vaccines for populations:

"We‚Äôre planning to hand out extra lifejackets to people who already have lifejackets, while we‚Äôre leaving other people to drown without a single lifejacket" 

-Dr. Mike Ryan, WHO health emergency programme.

https://t.co/J6JMFPT27B https://t.co/jjYcsrGExK

Disappointing news.

1. There is decent data to support #COVID19 vaccine boosters for select populations (e.g. immunocompromised) but it's a stretch to extend this to everyone.

2. Billions in low/middle income countries are waiting for 1st doses while getting throttled by Delta. https://t.co/Dgvu3Yd9ue

#COVID19 vaccines in Ontario:

1. Vaccines for all who work in healthcare & public education...those who choose to not get vaccinated will have to test regularly.

2. Booster vaccines for immunocompromised & Long Term Care.

3. Those turning 12 in 2021 eligible.

All good moves. https://t.co/if3IZ0sAhH

#COVID19 booster vaccines:

1. We may need these at some point, but not now (for the general population).

2. Certainly should not be giving boosters when billions of people (mainly in low/middle income countries) have not received a 1st dose.

https://t.co/OCke0nT3C6
RT @AnthonyDaleOHA: Delta is starting to put more people in ICU. 10 new adult patients with COVID related critical illness admitted to crit‚Ä¶

Those age 12 *or turning 12* this year are eligible for #COVID19 vaccination in Manitoba. (Alberta does this too).

This allows for thousands more to be vaccinated in Grade 7 and can help create a safer school environment.

https://t.co/ivrp75Edcp by @r_bergen

#COVID19 vaccine mandates in Canada:

1. Promotes vaccination.

2. Helps create safer indoor spaces.

3. Some still can't/won't/didn't get vaccinated for a variety of reasons...agree that alternatives like rapid testing can help.

Nuance by @adamsmiller https://t.co/UtL2ildD64
